TicTacToe Documentation - CIS F003A Fall 2016¶

System Requirements¶

  • PyGame
  • Python 3.5.2 (Anaconda)

Screenshots¶

Updates¶

  • Added Welcome screen
  • Updated UI for the game
  • Added Game-over Screen and Statistics
  • Added add_button, add_sound, add_text_to_screen methods

TicTacToe Library¶

Board Class¶

class lib.Board(grid_size=3, box_size=200, border=20, line_width=5)[source]¶

Bases: object

TicTacToe Board

Parameters:
  • grid_size – number of grids in the Board (Default = 3)
  • box_size – number of boxes in the Board (Default = 200)
  • border – the border of the board to determine where to start drawing
  • line_width – the width of lines that separate each box
  • surface_size – size of the window
  • surface – Game window
  • game_over – state if game is over
  • result – save result of player 1 and player [default = 0,0]. update after every game
add_button(size, color, text, text_color)[source]¶

Add a button to the screen

Parameters:
  • size – array_like shape of the button.
  • color – color for the button
  • text – message of the text
  • text_color – color of the text
Returns:

a button the screen
add_sound(path)[source]¶

Add sound to the game :param self: :param path: path to audio file :return: play sound

add_text_to_screen(message, color, size='small', yoffset=0, rect_color=(255, 255, 255), xoffset=0)[source]¶

Display a message at the middle of the screen

Parameters:
  • message – the message to the screen
  • color – color of the text
  • size – size of the size
  • xoffset – offset to the middle horizontal position [default = 0]
  • yoffset – offset to the middle vertical position [default = 0]
  • rect_color – background color [default is white[
Returns:

Returns:update self.game_over

Returns:dispaly winner and current scores

get_box_at_pixel(x, y)[source]¶

Get which box play has clicked

Parameters:
  • x – x-axis value on the window
  • y – y-axis value on the window
Returns:

box where player clicks. None if box is not found

Parameters:pos – position of a button

Determine turn of players and draw line/circle X = 1 O = 2

Parameters:box – a box user has selected
Returns:

  • y – y-axis value

text_objects(text, color, size='small', rect_color=(255, 255, 255))[source]¶

Create a dynamic text object

Parameters:
  • text – message
  • color – RGB color
  • size – size “small”, “medium”, “large” [default = small]
  • rect_color – color of the rectangle boundary

text, text_surface
turn = 1¶

Box Class¶

class lib.Box(x, y, size, board)[source]¶

Bases: object

Box where the x’s and o’s are drawn

Parameters:
  • state – global variables [default = 0, if box is marked then state = 1]
  • size – size of the box
  • line_width – width of the X mark
  • rect – pygame rectangle is drawn on this box
  • board – the board this box uses to drawn

Initialize a box

Parameters:
  • x – x-axis value
  • y – y-axis value
  • size – size of this box
  • board – the board it will use to draw
mark_o()[source]¶

Mark O on the screen when player clicks on the screen

Returns:draw an O mark on the box that player clicks
mark_x()[source]¶

Mark X on the screen when player clicks on the screen

Returns:draw X mark on the box that player clicks
state = 0¶
